summary: The 3D Printed Gun Safety Act of 2025 aims to amend Title 18 of the United States Code to prohibit the online distribution of digital instructions (CAD files or code) that can be used to program 3D printers to produce firearms or complete firearm frames/receivers. The bill highlights concerns about the proliferation of untraceable, 3D-printed firearms, their potential impact on public safety, and their ability to undermine existing federal firearms regulations.
